alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 14 at 1:46PM MST until February 15 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY FOR AREAS ALONG AND EAST OF I-25 AND ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40 DUE TO STRONG WINDS...LOW HUMIDITY...ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS... .Above normal temperatures will combine with strong southwest winds, very low humidity, and unstable conditions on Tuesday to generate critical fire weather conditions mainly along and south of I-40 and along and east of I-25 below any significant snowpack. Strong southwest winds will continue through Tuesday night into Wednesday across parts of the southern high terrain and eastern plains. A Fire Weather Watch is in effect Wednesday for the East Central Plains mainly east of the Pecos Valley. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 6 PM MST Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains, Northeast Highlands, Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northwest Highlands and West Central Highlands from 11 AM to 6 PM Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20-35 mph with gusts of 40-50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from around 6 to 10 percent. About 5 to 7 hours of single digit relative humidities are expected Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
